October 24, 2024
Tajuanda Carey
SUMPTER HOUSE
21802 CLARK RD,
BELLEVILLE, MI, 48111-8300
Re: License #: CI820308026
Dear Tajuanda Carey:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/04/2024 and 10/17/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you
will be receiving the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is
nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
Enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• N/A - No technical assistance was provided.
V. CONSULTATION

The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• N/A as no consultation was provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Sumpter House is operated under Spectrum Human Services. Spectrum Human
Service Inc. is a 501(c)3. Their financial audit was reviewed and found fiscally
sound. No issues or concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was received and reviewed. Assessment
indicates there were not any barriers or systemic factors impacting rule
compliance.
Spectrum is repurposing Sumpter House and is changing the contract from
general to mental health behavioral stabilization for males age 14-17 years old.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The current Chief Administrator was interviewed during the onsite assessment.
She discussed the process and decision of the agency to change the population
served. She also shared goals and strengths of the program.
The program does not currently have any youth placed in the program; thus no
interviews were completed.
Description of Agency Walk Through

An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on 10/04/2024 and
10/17/2024. There were no issues or safety concerns noted. Appropriate
updates have been made to the decor, furniture and overall facility to provide an
environment that is fitting for male program participants.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
10/24/2024
